<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ki1046_exhibit_10.33"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ki1046_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 10.33    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ki1046_adobe_systems_incorporated_199__ado03651"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ki1046_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED    <BR>    <BR>    1996 OUTSIDE DIRECTORS STOCK OPTION PLAN<BR>  </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>(as amended through September&nbsp;15, 2003)    <BR></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Establishment, Purpose and Term of Plan</U>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Establishment.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Adobe Systems Incorporated Restricted Stock Option Plan was initially established
effective March&nbsp;27, 1987 and amended from time to time thereafter (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Initial Plan</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"). The Initial Plan was amended and restated in its entirety
as the Adobe Systems Incorporated 1996 Outside Directors Stock Option Plan (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Plan</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") effective as of the date of its approval by the stockholders of
the Company, April&nbsp;5, 1995 (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Effective Date</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"). </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Purpose.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The purpose of the Plan is to advance the interests of the Participating Company Group and its
stockholders by providing an incentive to attract and retain highly qualified persons to serve as Outside Directors of the Company and by creating additional incentive for Outside Directors to promote
the growth and profitability of the Participating Company Group. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Term of Plan.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Plan shall continue in effect until the earlier of its termination by the Board or the
date on which all of the shares of Stock available for issuance under the Plan have been issued and all restrictions on such shares under the terms of the Plan and the agreements evidencing Options
granted under the Plan have lapsed. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Definitions and Construction</U>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Definitions.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Whenever used herein, the following terms shall have their respective meanings set forth below: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Board</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the Board of Directors of the Company. If one or more Committees have been appointed by the Board to
administer the Plan, "Board" also means such Committee(s). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Code</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, and any applicable regulations promulgated thereunder. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Committee</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a committee of the Board duly appointed to administer the Plan and having such powers as shall be
specified by the Board. Unless the powers of the Committee have been specifically limited, the Committee shall have all of the powers of the Board granted herein, including, without limitation, the
power to amend or terminate the Plan at any time, subject to the terms of the Plan and any applicable limitations imposed by law. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Company</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means Adobe Systems Incorporated, a Delaware corporation, or any successor corporation thereto. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Consultant</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any person, including an advisor, engaged by a Participating Company to render services other than as
an Employee or a Director. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Director</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a member of the Board or the board of directors of any other Participating Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Employee</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any person treated as an employee (including an officer or a Director who is also treated as an
employee) in the records of a Participating Company; provided, however, that neither service as a Director nor payment of a director's fee shall be sufficient to constitute employment for purposes of
the Plan. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2127850",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",CHK=430292,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK018:[04PAL6.04PAL1046]KI1046A.;3',USER='GMEDINA',CD=';5-FEB-2004;00:16' -->
<A NAME="page_ki1046_1_2"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(h)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Exchange Act</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Fair Market Value</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, as of any date, if there is then a public market for the Stock, the closing price of the Stock
(or the mean of the closing bid and asked prices of the Stock if the Stock is so reported instead) as reported on the National Association of Securities Dealers Automated Quotation
("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Nasdaq</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") System, the Nasdaq National Market System or such other national or regional securities exchange or market system constituting the primary
market for the Stock. If the relevant date does not fall on a day on which the Stock is trading on Nasdaq, the Nasdaq National Market System or other national or regional securities exchange or market
system, the date on which the Fair Market Value shall be established shall be the last day on which the Stock was so traded prior to the relevant date. If there is then no public market for the Stock,
the Fair Market Value on any relevant date shall be as determined by the Board without regard to any restriction other than a restriction which, by its terms, will never lapse. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(j)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Option</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a right to purchase Stock (subject to adjustment as provided in Section&nbsp;4.2) pursuant to the terms
and conditions of the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(k)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Optionee</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a person who has been granted one or more Options. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(l)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Option Agreement</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a written agreement between the Company and an Optionee setting forth the terms, conditions and
restrictions of the Option granted to the Optionee. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(m)&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Outside Director</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means a Director of the Company who is not an officer of the Company, an Employee, or a Consultant. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(n)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Parent Corporation</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any present or future "parent corporation" of the Company, as defined in Section&nbsp;424(e)
of the Code. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(o)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Participating Company</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the Company or any Parent Corporation or Subsidiary Corporation. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(p)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Participating Company Group</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means, at any point in time, all corporations collectively which are then Participating
Companies. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(q)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Rule&nbsp;16b-3</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means Rule&nbsp;16b-3 as promulgated under the Exchange Act, as amended
from time to time, or any successor rule or regulation. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(r)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Service</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the Optionee's service as a Director. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(s)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Stock</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means the common stock of the Company, as adjusted from time to time in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.2. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(t)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Subsidiary Corporation</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" means any present or future "subsidiary corporation" of the Company, as defined in
Section&nbsp;424(f) of the Code. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Construction.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Captions and titles contained herein are for convenience only and shall not affect the meaning
or interpretation of any provision of the Plan. Except when otherwise indicated by the context, the singular shall include the plural, the plural shall include the singular, and use of the term "or"
shall not be exclusive. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Administration</U>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Administration by the Board.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Plan shall be administered by the Board, including any duly appointed
Committee of the Board. All questions of interpretation of the Plan or of any Option shall be determined by the Board, and such determinations shall be final and binding upon all persons having an
interest in the Plan or such Option. Any officer of a Participating Company </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2127850",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",CHK=9575,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK018:[04PAL6.04PAL1046]KI1046A.;3',USER='GMEDINA',CD=';5-FEB-2004;00:16' -->
<A NAME="page_ki1046_1_3"> </A>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>shall
have the authority to act on behalf of the Company with respect to any matter, right, obligation, determination or election which is the responsibility of or which is allocated to the Company
herein, provided the officer has apparent authority with respect to such matter, right, obligation, determination or election. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Limitations on Authority of the Board.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise provided herein, the Board shall have no
authority, discretion, or power to select the Outside Directors who will receive Options, to set the exercise price of the Options, to determine the number of shares of Stock to be subject to an
Option or the time at which an Option shall be granted, to establish the duration of an Option, or to alter any other terms or conditions specified in the Plan, except in the sense of administering
the Plan subject to the provisions of the Plan. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Shares Subject to Plan</U>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Maximum Number of Shares Issuable.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to adjustment as provided in Section&nbsp;4.2, the maximum
aggregate number of shares of Stock that may be issued under the Plan shall be three million two hundred fifty thousand (3,250,000) and shall consist of authorized but unissued shares or reacquired
shares of Stock or any combination thereof. If an outstanding Option for any reason expires or is terminated or canceled or shares of Stock acquired, subject to repurchase, upon the exercise of an
Option are repurchased by the Company, the shares of Stock allocable to the unexercised portion of such Option, or such repurchased shares of Stock, shall again be available for issuance under the
Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Adjustments for Changes in Capital Structure.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event of any stock dividend, stock split, reverse stock
split, recapitalization, combination, reclassification or similar change in the capital structure of the Company, appropriate adjustments shall be made in the number and class of shares subject to the
Plan, and to any outstanding Options, and in the exercise price of any outstanding Options. For any changes in capital structure made after April&nbsp;12, 2001, no adjustments shall be made in the
number and class of shares subject to the "Initial Option" or "Annual Option" (as defined in Section&nbsp;6.1). If a majority of the shares which are of the same class as the shares that are subject
to outstanding Options are exchanged for, converted into, or otherwise become (whether or not pursuant to a Transfer of Control as defined in Section&nbsp;8.1) shares of another corporation (the
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>New Shares</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), the Board may unilaterally amend the outstanding Options to provide that such Options are exercisable for New Shares. In the event of any
such amendment, the number of shares subject to, and the exercise price of, the outstanding Options shall be adjusted in a fair and equitable manner as determined by the Board, in its sole discretion.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, any fractional share resulting from an adjustment pursuant to this Section&nbsp;4.2 shall be rounded down to the nearest whole number, and in no event may the exercise
price of any Option be decreased to an amount less than the par value, if any, of the stock subject to the Option. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Eligibility and Type of Options</U>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Persons Eligible for Options.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An Option shall be granted only to a person who, at the time of grant, is an
Outside Director. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Options Authorized.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Options shall be nonstatutory stock options; that is, options which are not treated as
incentive stock options within the meaning of Section&nbsp;422(b) of the Code. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Terms and Conditions of Options</U>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Options shall be evidenced by Option Agreements
specifying the number of shares of Stock covered thereby, in such form as the Board shall from time to </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="2127850",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",CHK=753660,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK018:[04PAL6.04PAL1046]KI1046A.;3',USER='GMEDINA',CD=';5-FEB-2004;00:16' -->
<A NAME="page_ki1046_1_4"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>time
establish. Option Agreements may incorporate all or any of the terms of the Plan by reference and shall comply with and be subject to the following terms and conditions: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Automatic Grant of Options.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to execution by an Outside Director of the appropriate Option Agreement,
Options shall be granted automatically and without further action of the Board, as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Initial Option.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior to December&nbsp;1, 2003</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, each person who is first elected
or appointed as an Outside Director after the Effective Date shall be granted an Option to purchase sixty thousand (60,000) shares of Stock on the date of such initial election or appointment. </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Commencing on December&nbsp;1,
2003</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, each person who is first elected or appointed as an Outside Director after the Effective Date shall be granted an
Option to purchase fifty thousand (50,000) shares of Stock on the date of such initial election or appointment (Each, an "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Initial Option</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>").
Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, a Director of the Company who previously did not qualify as an Outside Director shall not receive an Initial Option in the event that such Director
subsequently becomes an Outside Director. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Annual Option.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior to December&nbsp;1, 2003</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, each Outside Director (including
any Director of the Company who previously did not qualify as an Outside Director but who subsequently becomes an Outside Director) shall be granted, on the day immediately following the day of each
annual meeting of the stockholders of the Company (an "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Annual Meeting</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") following which such person remains an Outside Director, an Option to purchase
forty thousand (40,000) shares of stock. </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Commencing on December&nbsp;1, 2003</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, each Outside Director (including any Director of the Company who
previously did not qualify as an Outside Director but who subsequently becomes an Outside Director) shall be granted, on the day immediately following the day of an Annual Meeting following which such
person remains an Outside Director, an Option to purchase twenty-five thousand (25,000) shares of Stock (Each, an "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Annual Option</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>").
Notwithstanding the foregoing, an Outside Director who received an Initial Option subsequent to the preceding year's Annual Meeting shall not receive an Annual Option with respect to the current
year's Annual Meeting. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Right to Decline Option.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding the foregoing, any person may elect not to receive an Option by
delivering written notice of such election to the Board no later than the day prior to the date such Option would otherwise be granted. A person so declining an Option shall receive no payment or
other consideration in lieu of such declined Option. A person who has declined an Option may revoke such election by delivering written notice of such revocation to the Board no later than the day
prior to the date such Option would be granted pursuant to Section&nbsp;6.1(a) or (b), as the case may be. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Discretion to Vary Option Size.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding any provision of the Plan to the contrary, the Board may, in
its sole discretion, increase or decrease the number of shares of Stock that would otherwise be subject to one or more Initial Options or Annual Options to be granted pursuant to Section&nbsp;6.1
if, at the time of such exercise of discretion, (a)&nbsp;the "disinterested administration" provisions contained in paragraph&nbsp;(c)(2)(i)&nbsp;of Rule&nbsp;16b-3 are no longer
applicable to any employee benefit plan maintained by a Participating Company and (b)&nbsp;the exercise of such discretion would not otherwise preclude any transaction in an equity security of the
Company by an officer or Director of a Participating Company from being exempt from Section&nbsp;16(b) of the Exchange Act pursuant to Rule&nbsp;16b-3. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Exercise Price.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The exercise price per share of Stock subject to an Option shall be the Fair Market Value of
a share of Stock on the date the Option is granted. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=4,EFW="2127850",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",CHK=780873,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK018:[04PAL6.04PAL1046]KI1046A.;3',USER='GMEDINA',CD=';5-FEB-2004;00:16' -->
<A NAME="page_ki1046_1_5"> </A>
<UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Exercise Period.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Option shall terminate and cease to be exercisable on the date ten (10)&nbsp;years
after the date of grant of the Option unless earlier terminated pursuant to the terms of the Plan or the Option Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.5&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Right to Exercise Options.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise provided in the Plan or in the Option Agreement and provided
that the Optionee's Service has been continuous from the date of Option grant until the relevant date set forth below, each Option, whether an Initial Option or an Annual Option, shall become vested
and exercisable cumulatively for shares of Stock subject to the Option (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Option Shares</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>") as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;25%
of the Option Shares shall vest and first become exercisable on the day immediately preceding the day of the first Annual Meeting following the date of Option grant. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;25%
of the Option Shares shall vest and first become exercisable on the day immediately preceding the day of the second Annual Meeting following the date of Option
grant. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;50%
of the Option Shares shall vest and first become exercisable on the day immediately preceding the day of the third Annual Meeting following the date of Option grant. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.6&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Payment of Exercise Price.</I></B></FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Forms of Consideration Authorized.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise provided below, payment of the exercise price for the
number of shares of Stock being purchased pursuant to any Option shall be made (i)&nbsp;in cash, by check, or cash equivalent, (ii)&nbsp;by tender to the Company of shares of Stock owned by the
Optionee having a Fair Market Value not less than the exercise price, (iii)&nbsp;by the assignment of the proceeds of a sale or loan with respect to some or all of the shares being acquired upon the
exercise of the Option (including, without limitation, through an exercise complying with the provisions of Regulation&nbsp;T as promulgated from time to time by the Board of Governors of the
Federal Reserve System) (a "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Cashless Exercise</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), or (iv)&nbsp;by any combination thereof. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Tender of Stock.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding the foregoing, an Option may not be exercised by tender to the Company of
shares of Stock to the extent such tender of Stock would constitute a violation of the provisions of any law, regulation or agreement restricting the redemption of the Company's stock. Unless
otherwise provided by the Board, an Option may not be exercised by tender to the Company of shares of Stock unless such shares either have been owned by the Optionee for more than six
(6)&nbsp;months or were not acquired, directly or indirectly, from the Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>Cashless Exercise.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company reserves, at any and all times, the right, in the Company's sole and absolute
discretion, to establish, decline to approve or terminate any program or procedures for the exercise of Options by means of a Cashless Exercise. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.7&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Tax Withholding.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company shall have the right, but not the obligation, to deduct from the shares of
Stock issuable upon the exercise of an Option, or to accept from the Optionee the tender of, a number of whole shares of Stock having a Fair Market Value equal to all or any part of the federal,
state, local and foreign taxes, if any, required by law to be withheld by the Participating Company Group with respect to such Option or the shares acquired upon exercise thereof. Alternatively or in
addition, in its sole discretion, the Company shall have the right to require the Optionee to make adequate provision for any such tax withholding obligations of the Participating Company Group
arising in connection with the Option or the shares acquired upon exercise thereof. The Company shall have no obligation to deliver shares of Stock until the Participating Company Group's tax
withholding obligations have been satisfied. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=5,EFW="2127850",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",CHK=661867,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK018:[04PAL6.04PAL1046]KI1046A.;3',USER='GMEDINA',CD=';5-FEB-2004;00:16' -->
<A NAME="page_ki1046_1_6"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Standard Form of Option Agreement</U>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Initial Option.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unless otherwise provided for by the Board at the time an Initial Option is granted, each
Initial Option shall comply with and be subject to the terms and conditions set forth in the form of Nonstatutory Stock Option Agreement for Outside Directors (Initial Option) adopted by the Board
concurrently with its adoption of the Plan and as amended from time to time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Annual Option.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unless otherwise provided for by the Board at the time an Annual Option is granted, each
Annual Option shall comply with and be subject to the terms and conditions set forth in the form of Nonstatutory Stock Option Agreement for Outside Directors (Annual Option) adopted by the Board
concurrently with its adoption of the Plan and as amended from time to time. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Authority to Vary Terms.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to the limitations set forth in Section&nbsp;3.2, the Board shall have
the authority from time to time to vary the terms of any of the standard forms of Option Agreement described in this Section&nbsp;7 either in connection with the grant or amendment of an individual
Option or in connection with the authorization of a new standard form or forms; provided, however, that the
terms and conditions of any such new, revised or amended standard form or forms of Option Agreement are not inconsistent with the terms of the Plan. Such authority shall include, but not by way of
limitation, the authority to grant Options which are immediately exercisable subject to the Company's right to repurchase any unvested shares of Stock acquired by the Optionee upon the exercise of an
Option in the event such Optionee's Service is terminated for any reason. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Transfer of Control</U>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Definition.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Transfer of Control</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" shall be deemed to have
occurred in the event any of the following occurs with respect to the Company: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the
direct or indirect sale or exchange by the stockholders of the Company of all or substantially all of the stock of the Company where the stockholders of the Company
before such sale or exchange do not retain, directly or indirectly, at least a majority of the beneficial interest in the voting stock of the Company; </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a
merger or consolidation in which the stockholders of the Company before such merger or consolidation do not retain, directly or indirectly at least a majority of the
beneficial interest in the voting stock of the Company; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;the
sale, exchange, or transfer of all or substantially all of the assets of the Company (other than a sale, exchange, or transfer to one or more corporations where the
stockholders of the Company before such sale, exchange or transfer retain, directly or indirectly, at least a majority of the beneficial interest in the voting stock of the corporations to which the
assets were transferred); or </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a
liquidation or dissolution of the Company. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B><I>Effect of Transfer of Control on Options.</I></B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event of a Transfer of Control, any unexercisable or
unvested portion of the outstanding Options shall be immediately exercisable and vested in full as of the date thirty (30)&nbsp;days prior to the date of the Transfer of Control. The exercise or
vesting of any Option that was permissible solely by reason of this Section&nbsp;8.2 shall be conditioned upon the consummation of the Transfer of Control. In addition, the surviving, continuing,
successor, or purchasing corporation or parent corporation thereof, as the case may be (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Acquiring Corporation</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), may either assume the Company's
rights and obligations under outstanding Options or substitute for outstanding Options substantially equivalent options for the Acquiring Corporation's stock. Any Options which are neither assumed or
substituted for by the </FONT></P>

</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>6</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=6,EFW="2127850",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",CHK=419987,FOLIO='6',FILE='DISK018:[04PAL6.04PAL1046]KI1046A.;3',USER='GMEDINA',CD=';5-FEB-2004;00:16' -->
<A NAME="page_ki1046_1_7"> </A>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Acquiring
Corporation in connection with the Transfer of Control nor exercised as of the date of the Transfer of Control shall terminate and cease to be outstanding effective as of the date of the
Transfer of Control. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Nontransferability of Options</U>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the lifetime of the Optionee, an Option
shall be exercisable only by the Optionee or the Optionee's guardian or legal representative. No Option shall be assignable or transferable by the Optionee, except by will or by the laws of descent
and distribution. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Termination or Amendment of Plan</U>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Board may terminate or amend the Plan at
any time. However, subject to changes in the law or other legal requirements that would permit otherwise, without the approval of the Company's stockholders, there shall be (a)&nbsp;no increase in
the total number of shares of Stock that may be issued under the Plan (except by operation of the provisions of Section&nbsp;4.2), and (b)&nbsp;no expansion in the class of persons eligible to
receive Options. Furthermore, to the extent required by Rule&nbsp;16b-3, provisions of the Plan addressing eligibility to participate in the Plan and the amount, price and timing of
Options shall not be amended more than once every six (6)&nbsp;months, other than to comport with changes in the Code, the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended, or the rules
hereunder. In any event, no termination or amendment of the Plan may adversely affect any then outstanding Option, or any unexercised portion thereof, without the consent of the Optionee, unless such
termination or amendment is necessary to comply with any applicable law or government regulation. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<U>Continuation of Initial Plan as to Outstanding Options</U>.</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any other provision of
the Plan to the contrary notwithstanding, the terms of the Initial Plan shall remain in effect and apply to all Options granted pursuant to the Initial Plan. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>7</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=7,EFW="2127850",CP="ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED",DN="3",CHK=712901,FOLIO='7',FILE='DISK018:[04PAL6.04PAL1046]KI1046A.;3',USER='GMEDINA',CD=';5-FEB-2004;00:16' -->
<A NAME="page_ki1046_1_8"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned Secretary of the Company certifies that the foregoing Adobe Systems Incorporated 1996 Outside Directors Stock Option Plan was duly adopted by the
Board
on December&nbsp;20, 1995 and further amended on December&nbsp;17, 1999, April&nbsp;12, 2001, February&nbsp;12, 2002 and September&nbsp;15, 2003. </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

Secretary</FONT></TD>
</TR>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>8</FONT></P>

<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ADOBE SYSTEMS INCORPORATED    <BR>    <BR>    EXHIBIT 23    <BR>    <BR>    INDEPENDENT AUDITORS' CONSENT    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Board of Directors<BR>
Adobe Systems Incorporated </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
consent to the incorporation by reference in the Registration Statements (No.&nbsp;33-10753, No.&nbsp;33-18986, No.&nbsp;33-23171,
No.&nbsp;33-30976, No.&nbsp;33-36501, No.&nbsp;33-38387, No.&nbsp;33-48210, No.&nbsp;33-63518, No.&nbsp;33-78506,
No.&nbsp;33-83030, No.&nbsp;33-83502, No.&nbsp;33-83504, No.&nbsp;33-84396, No.&nbsp;33-86482, No.&nbsp;33-59335,
No.&nbsp;33-63849, No.&nbsp;33-63851, No.&nbsp;333-28195, No.&nbsp;333-28203, No.&nbsp;333-28207,
No.&nbsp;333-57589, No.&nbsp;333-81191, No.&nbsp;333- 87165, No.&nbsp;333-39524, No.&nbsp;333-52214,
No.&nbsp;333-57074, No.&nbsp;333-72424, No.&nbsp;333-90518, and No.&nbsp;333-108014) on Form&nbsp;S-8 of Adobe Systems
Incorporated of our report dated December&nbsp;9, 2003, with respect to the consolidated balance sheets of Adobe Systems Incorporated as of November&nbsp;28, 2003 and November&nbsp;29, 2002, and
the related consolidated statements of income, stockholders' equity and other comprehensive income, and cash flows for each of the years in the three-year period ended November&nbsp;28,
2003, and related financial statement schedule, appearing elsewhere in this Form&nbsp;10-K. Our report refers to changes in accounting for goodwill in 2003. </FONT></P>

LLP<BR>
Mountain View, California<BR>
February 4, 2003 </FONT></P>

<FILENAME>a2127850zex-31_1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 31.1
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#04PAL1046_9">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ko1046_exhibit_31.1"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ko1046_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 31.1    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ko1046_certification"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ko1046_2"> </A></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>CERTIFICATION    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>I,
Bruce R. Chizen, Chief Executive Officer of the registrant, certify that: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>I
have reviewed this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of Adobe Systems Incorporated;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) for the registrant and have:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating
to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Evaluated
the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and
procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Disclosed
in this report any change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant's
fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant's internal control over financial reporting; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal controls over financial reporting, to the registrant's auditors and the
audit committee of the registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>All
significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the
registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="47%"><FONT SIZE=2>Dated: February&nbsp;5, 2004</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%"><FONT SIZE=2>/s/&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>BRUCE R. CHIZEN</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><HR NOSHADE><FONT SIZE=2> Bruce R. Chizen<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>President and Chief Executive
Officer</I></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kq1046_exhibit_31.2"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kq1046_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 31.2    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kq1046_certification"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kq1046_2"> </A></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>CERTIFICATION    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>I,
Murray J. Demo, Chief Financial Officer of the registrant, certify that: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>I
have reviewed this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of Adobe Systems Incorporated;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) for the registrant and have:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Designed
such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating
to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Evaluated
the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and
procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Disclosed
in this report any change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant's
fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant's internal control over financial reporting; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD></DL>
</DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
registrant's other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal controls over financial reporting, to the registrant's auditors and the
audit committee of the registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>All
significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the
registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ks1046_exhibit_32.1"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ks1046_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 32.1    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ks1046_certification_pursuant_to_18_u__cer03819"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ks1046_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO<BR>  18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350,<BR>  AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO<BR>  SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002    <BR></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>In
connection with the Annual Report of Adobe Systems Incorporated (the "Registrant") on Form&nbsp;10-K for the annual period ended November&nbsp;28, 2003 as filed with the Securities
and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the "Report"), I, Bruce R. Chizen, President and Chief Executive Officer of the Registrant, certify, in accordance with 18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350, as
adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that to the best of my knowledge: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(1)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
Report, to which this certification is attached as Exhibit&nbsp;32.1, fully complies with the requirements of section&nbsp;13(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(2)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Registrant. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="47%"><FONT SIZE=2>Dated: February&nbsp;5, 2004</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%"><FONT SIZE=2>/s/&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>BRUCE R. CHIZEN</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><HR NOSHADE><FONT SIZE=2> Bruce R. Chizen<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>President and Chief Executive
Officer</I></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>A signed original of this written statement required by Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 has been provided to the Registrant and will be retained by the
Registrant and furnished to the Securities and Exchange Commission or its staff upon request.</I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>This certification accompanies the Form&nbsp;10-K to which it relates, is not deemed filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission and is not to be
incorporated by reference into any filing of the Registrant under the Securities Act of 1933 or the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (whether made before or after the date of the
Form&nbsp;10-K), irrespective of any general incorporation language contained in such filing.</I></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ku1046_exhibit_32.2"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ku1046_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 32.2    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ku1046_certification_pursuant_to_18_u__cer03819"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ku1046_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO<BR>  18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350,<BR>  AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO<BR>  SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002    <BR></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>In
connection with the Annual Report of Adobe Systems Incorporated (the "Registrant") on Form&nbsp;10-K for the annual period ended November&nbsp;28, 2003 as filed with the Securities
and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the "Report"), I, Murray J. Demo, Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of the Registrant, certify, in accordance with 18 U.S.C.
Section&nbsp;1350, as adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that to the best of my knowledge: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(1)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
Report, to which this certification is attached as Exhibit&nbsp;32.2, fully complies with the requirements of section&nbsp;13(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(2)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Registrant. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="47%"><FONT SIZE=2>Dated: February&nbsp;5, 2004</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%"><FONT SIZE=2>/s/&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>MURRAY J. DEMO</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><HR NOSHADE><FONT SIZE=2> Murray J. Demo<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Senior Vice President and Chief Financial
Officer</I></FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>A signed original of this written statement required by Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 has been provided to the Registrant and will be retained by the
Registrant and furnished to the Securities and Exchange Commission or its staff upon request.</I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>This certification accompanies the Form&nbsp;10-K to which it relates, is not deemed filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission and is not to be
incorporated by reference into any filing of the Registrant under the Securities Act of 1933 or the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (whether made before or after the date of the
Form&nbsp;10-K), irrespective of any general incorporation language contained in such filing.</I></FONT></P>
